moduleInfo.moduleTitle: Basic Theory and Practices/04 Algorithmic Reality/Platform Differences

overview.quote: A good video is a good video, full stop, and from my experience will perform well on all platforms.
overview.introText: Understanding subtle algorithmic differences between major short-form platforms while recognizing the universal principles that drive engagement across all of them.

keyTerms.definition: How different algorithms prioritize certain metrics (shares, comments, watch time) compared to others.
How user behavior changes between platforms based on social context and intended platform use.
Adjusting content length, style, and presentation to match platform-specific preferences.
How similar content performs across different platforms relative to platform-specific averages.

actionPlan: Adjust content length for each platform
Analyze engagement type differences by platform

mainContent.title: Core Similarities
mainContent.text: All short-form platforms have the same goal: maximizing user watch time. Despite differences, a truly engaging video will perform well everywhere, just with varying view counts.

mainContent.title: Instagram vs. TikTok
mainContent.text: Instagram prioritizes shorter, more visual content with high completion rates and shares, while TikTok favors longer, dialogue-heavy videos that generate conversation in comments.

mainContent.title: Length Optimization
mainContent.text: Ultra-short content (under 7 seconds) can perform well on Instagram but might be flagged as spam on TikTok. Each platform has ideal length ranges based on user behavior.

mainContent.title: User Context Matters More
mainContent.text: Focus less on algorithm differences and more on how users behave differently across platforms. TikTok users are anonymous entertainment-seekers; Instagram users are social and identity-focused.

proTips.text: Don't chase algorithm updatesâ€”they change constantly. Instead, test which format types consistently perform well for your niche on each platform.

finalWords.description: Great content works everywhere; optimize format but prioritize engagement.
